page.title: 15ROAD TRANSPORT.
page.content: Though trams provided transport as long ago as 1871 by 1934 they were all withdrawn from the Horsforth and Calverley area.Private bus companies have now been replaced by services run by The West Yorkshire Passenger Transport.This includes bus services between Leeds/Otley,Leeds/Ilkley and Leeds/Bradford along the main A65.Also Leeds Metro services link Horsforth and Leeds along this road.In the southern part of the grid along the A657 services from Leeds/Keighley and Leeds/Bradford run through Calverley.From north to south is part of the main Leeds ring road and this provides a busy commuter link between Horsforth and the Pudsey Bradford areas.Bus services also link Horsforth with Cookridge,Holt Park and the Rodley and Pudsey areas.Farsley and Bramley also link with Leeds by bus.
